name: description
description: Short prose definition of what it means for the task to be performed correctly at the level of the Detailed Instructions and Task Criteria section.

name: logical_units
description: List of logical units that correspond to fields or subfields in the output schema, each with its own tagged criteria lines.

tasks.name: unit_name
tasks.description: Name of the logical unit; must match or obviously correspond to a field or subfield in the task's output schema (e.g. 'label', 'label.span', 'entity.type').

tasks.name: criteria
tasks.description: Tagged criteria entries that specify how this logical unit should behave and be judged.

tasks.name: criterion_type
tasks.description: Tag indicating the kind of criterion line.

class_definitions.description: Defines what this logical unit represents and its conceptual role.
class_definitions.inclusion: Specifies what must be included or counted as valid instances for this unit.
class_definitions.exclusion: Specifies what must not be included or counted as valid instances for this unit.
class_definitions.evidence: Defines the textual or structural evidence required in the input for this unit to be instantiated.
class_definitions.scope: Defines how instances of this unit should cover the input (e.g. one per span, all occurrences, at most one per document).
class_definitions.validity: Constraints that make a particular instance of this unit acceptable or well-formed.
class_definitions.threshold: Quantitative or qualitative thresholds, such as length limits, count limits, or confidence-like requirements.
class_definitions.note: Any additional clarifying note or rule that does not fit the other types.
class_definitions.other: Any other criterion type that the model must name explicitly in the text when used.

tasks.name: criterion_content
tasks.description: Plain-text content of the criterion line, written as a clear, standalone rule or description.

name: missing_info
description: Plain-text description of missing or ambiguous information that should be clarified with the user to fully specify the Detailed Instructions and Task Criteria section. Use a short paragraph or bullet-style list; if nothing is missing, return 'none'.
